Title: Fast algorithm of high-dimensional quantum state estimation via low measurement rates
Abstract: © 2017 IEEE.Based on the theoretical lower bounds of the number of measurements given by Compressive Sensing (CS), the quantum state estimation task can be formulated as a convex optimization problem subject to positive semi-definite and unit-trace Hermitian constraints. This paper proposes an improved Alternating Direction Multiplier Method (AD-MM) for high-dimensional quantum state reconstruction. The proposed method not only greatly reduces the computational complexity and speeds up the convergence, but also has a strong robustness to the noise. For the density matrix reconstruction of 11-qubit quantum system, the proposed algorithm achieves 4.54e-2 reconstruction error using 0.6% of total measurement data and 99.26 seconds.
